abstract: In a cost-cutting move, Google gives Dream phones instead of cash as year-end gift to employees.
snippet: In a cost-cutting move, Google gives Dream phones instead of cash as year-end gift to employees.
lead_paragraph: Google has cut its year-end bonuses, but by not nearly as much as the technology gossip site Valleywag reported on Monday. Valleywag’s report was later repeated by other news outlets. Google’s year-end gift to most of its more than 20,000 employees worldwide will be an unlocked Dream, the first mobile phone based on Google’s Android software, which is made by HTC and sold in the United States by T-Mobile under the name G1.
